Package org.texgen.signals.modifier

Signal classes that take a source signal and modify it to produce a new signal

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ClampSignal Takes the incoming signal and passes the value through after clamping it between 0 and 1
InvertSignal Takes an input signal and inverts it using (1-input), does not handle out of range issues and assumes a 0..1 range.
NoisySignal Adds a level of noise to the signal from the source.
SignalBand Takes a source signal and divides it into bands as opposed to a set of smooth values.
SignalMultiply Takes 2 input signals, calculates the u,v value and returns the 2 u,v, values multiplied together
SignalPower Takes an input signal, and returns the value raised to the power of power which is passed in to the constructor
SignalScale Takes an input source signal and scales it by a fixed value
SignalSum Returns the sum of the 2 input signal values for each u,v point
SignalThreshold Returns one signal or another depending on whether the input being evaluated is past a certain threshold value.
SignalUVRotate Rotates the u,v coordinates around the 0,0 axis and calcualtes the value from the source signal.
SignalUVScale Scales the u,v values by a fixed amount and returns a value based on the input source and the scales u,v values.
SignalUVTranslate Translates the u,v values by the offset amounts and returns a value from the input source using the newly translated u,v values.
 

Package org.texgen.signals.modifier Description

Signal classes that take a source signal and modify it to produce a new signal
